metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23219 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: The deprecated compatibility function clnt_create in the sunrpc module of the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34 copies its hostname argument on the stack without validating its length, which may result in a buffer overflow, potentially resulting in a denial of service or (if an application is not built with a stack protector enabled) arbitrary code execution.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Ubuntu has stack protector enabled since 2006, so this issue is only a denial of service.

criterions.comment: eglibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
